children.name: salesman/woman b1
children.definition: salesman/saleswoman/salesperson/ˈseɪlzmən, ˈseɪlzˌwʊmən, ˈseɪlzˌpɜːʳsən/  someone whose job is to persuade people, shops, and companies to buy their company’s products:
examples: người bán hàng
▪ i worked for a while as a salesman for a big computer corporation.
▪ gail has been the firm’s top saleswoman for the last two years.
salesmannoun[ c ] người bán hàng (nam)
a man whose job is selling things in a shop or directly to customers
_a car salesman
_a travelling salesman
_a door-to-door salesman
saleswomannoun[ c ]
a femalesalesperson

children.name: sales staff
children.partOfSpeech: [countable noun with singular or plural verb in british english]
children.definition: /ˈseɪlz ˌstɑːfǁ-ˌstæf/  the members of a company whose job is to persuade people to buy that company’s products, or to sell goods to people in a shop:
examples: nhân viên bán hàng
▪ the company has a sales staff of 600.
▪ customers liked the personal service the sales staff provided.

children.name: sales force
children.definition: noun lực lượng bán hàng; bộ phận bán hàng
examples: all the employees of a companywhose job is persuadingcustomers to buy their company's products or services

children.name: agent b2
children.definition: agentnounrepresenting đại lý
examples: a person who acts for or represents another
_please contact our agent inspainfor further information.

children.name: sales
children.definition: the department of a company that organizes and does the selling of the company's products or services
examples: _he works in sales.
_the sales department/manager

children.name: sales department
children.definition: _the /manager

children.name: sales force
children.definition: noun lực lượng bán hàng; bộ phận bán hàng
examples: all the employees of a companywhose job is persuading
customers to buy their company's products or services

children.name: marketeer x
children.definition: marketeernoun nhà buôn; thương nhân
examples: someone who works in or supports a particular market system
under the old regimeblackmarketeers would buy almost anything
from western tourists and resell it at an enormous profit.
freemarketeers are vehemently opposed to the new safety regulations.

children.name: supplier b2
children.definition: suppliernoun người (công ty) cung cấp, người tiếp tế
examples: [ c ] a company, person, etc. that provides things that people want or need, especially over a long period of time
_they used to be a leading supplierofmilitary equipment.
_he said that he had got the drugs from his usual supplier (= person who sells drugs illegally) .
suppliers
a company which sells something
_i'll contactthesuppliers and see if i can get the paint you want by friday.

children.name: auctioneer
children.definition: noun người điều khiển cuộc bán đấu giá
examples: a person in charge of an auction who calls out the prices that people offer

children.name: seller b1
children.definition: seller/ˈseləʳ/  the person who sells something to another person or companyin a business deal:
examples: bên bán
▪ both buyer and seller should agree on the terms before the contract is signed.
sellernoun[ c ] người bán
a person who is selling something
_flower/newspaper/souvenir sellers
_do you think the seller will accept £300, 000 for the house?

children.name: exporter
children.definition: noun người,quốc gia,hãng xuất khẩu
examples: a person, country or business that sells goods to another country
_japan is a major exporterofcars.

children.name: distributor
children.definition: noungoods nhà phân phối
examples: a person or organization that supplies goods to shops and companies
_a film distributor
_the largest software distributor
nhà phân phối phần mềm lớn nhất

children.name: sales assistant a2
children.definition: sales assistant alsoshop assistantbritish /salesclerkamerican /ˈseɪlz əˌsɪstənt, ˈʃɒp əˌsɪstəntǁˈʃɑːp-, ˈseɪlz ˌklɑːkǁ-ˌklɜːrk/  someone who deals with customers in a shop and sells them things:
examples: nhân viên bán hàng, người bán hàng
▪ rowan worked as a sales assistant in a beverly hills shopping mall.
▪ she’s a shop assistant in the shoe department.
▪ get advice from a knowledgeable sales clerk.

sales assistant/shop assistantbritish /sales clerkamerican /ˈseɪlz əˌsɪstənt, ˈʃɒp əˌsɪstəntǁˈʃɑːp-, ˈseɪlz ˌklɑːkǁ-ˌklɜːrk/ [countable noun] someone whose job is to serve customers and sell things in a shop, especially in a big shop such as a department store:
▪ she was a bit rude, that shop assistant, don’t you think?
▪ i’m working weekends as a sales clerk.
assistantnoun[ c ] người bán hàng
uksomeone who works in a shop, selling goods to customers and giving advice about the goods sold in the shop
_asales/shopassistant
sales assistantnoun[ c ]uk
a shop assistant
shop assistantnoun[ c ]uk(ussalesclerk) nhân viên bán hàng; người bán hàng
someone who serves customers in a shop

children.name: manager a2
children.definition: manager /ˈmænɪdʒəʳ/  someone who is in charge of a shop:
examples: ▪ i’d like to see the manager please.
branch/area manager
someone who is manager of all the shops owned by one particular company in one area
▪ ron was promoted to branch manager of the north west region.

children.name: shopkeeper b2
children.definition: shopkeeper/ˈʃɒpˌkiːpəʳǁˈʃɑːp-/  especially british someone who owns or is in charge of asmallshop:
examples: chủ tiệm
▪ the shopkeeper chased the boys out of his shop, accusing them of stealing.
▪ many immigrants have been highly successful as shopkeepers.
shopkeeper/ˈʃɒpˌkiːpəʳǁˈʃɑːp-/ [countable noun] british someone who owns or manages a small shop:
▪ a lot of the smaller shopkeepers didn’t have any insurance at all.
▪ the money for the christmas lights was raised by a group of local shopkeepers, who want to attract shoppers to the area.
storekeepernoun[ c ] chủcủa cửahiệu; chủtiệm
us forshopkeeper
shopkeepernoun[ c ] (us usuallystorekeeper)
a person who owns and manages a small shop

children.name: proprietor
children.definition: /prəˈpraɪətəʳ/  formal someone who owns a small shop:
examples: chủ tiệm
▪ proprietor ginny gavin serves fresh croissants and fruit at breakfast to guests at her inn.
proprietor of
▪ dan conrad, the proprietor of conrad’s bookstore, says that small stores such as his offer service and convenience.

children.name: merchant
children.definition: /ˈmɜːʳtʃənt/ american writtensomeone who owns or is in charge of a shop:
examples: chủ tiệm
▪ local merchants have had trouble with vandals breaking windows.
▪ merchants say sales have not been affected by the road repairs.

children.name: clerk
children.definition: noun ngườibán hàng
examples: ussomeone who sells things in a shop
_take your purchases to the(sales) clerk, and he will wrap them for you.

children.name: cashier
children.definition: noun nhân viên thu ngân (ở ngân hàng, cửa hàng, khách sạn...)
examples: a person whose job is to receive and pay out money in a shop, bank, restaurant, etc.

children.name: salesperson a2
children.definition: salespersonnoun người bán hàng
examples: a person whose job is selling things in a shop or directly to customers
a car/computer salesperson

children.name: vendor
children.definition: /ˈvendəʳ/  someone who sells things to people in the street:
examples: người bán dạo
▪ outside the theatre, there was a row of flower vendors.
▪ frank stopped to buy the evening paper from a news vendor.
street vendor
▪ flags sold by street vendors fluttered in the crowd of about 5,000

children.name: peddler
children.definition: noun người bán rong
examples: ( mainly ukpedlar) especially in the past, a person who travelled todifferent places to sell small goods, usually by going from house to house

children.name: hawker
children.definition: noun người bán hàng rong
examples: someone who sells goods informally in public places

children.name: bookseller
children.definition: noun người bán sách
examples: a person or company that sells books

children.name: fishmonger
children.definition: nounmainly uk người bán cá
examples: someone who sells fish, especially from a shop

children.name: florist
children.definition: noun người bán hoa
examples: a person who works in a shop which sells cut flowers and plants for inside the house

children.name: newsvendor
children.definition: noun người bán báo
examples: someone who sells newspapers

children.name: market trader
children.definition: /ˈmɑːʳkɪt ˌtreɪdəʳ, ˈmɑːʳkət ˌtreɪdəʳ/  british someone who sells things in a market:
examples: người bán ( ở chợ )
▪ the market traders have started a petition to try and stop the development going ahead.
